docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 8 -- The United Nations' planned $250,000,000 program for Korean reconstruction will be inadequate and must be reassessed within the next few months, J. Donald Kingsley, agent general for the United Nations Korean...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 8 -- The United Nations' planned $250,000,000 program for Korean reconstruction will be inadequate and must be reassessed within the next few months, J. Donald Kingsley, agent general for the United Nations Korean Reconstruction Agency, said today.
docs.abstract: Agent Gen Kingsley sees UN's $250-million program inadequate; urges early reassessment

headline.main: WIDER RELIEF SET-UP URGED; U. N. Aide Says $250,000,000 Plan Will Not Meet Korean Needs

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, April 8 -- The United States presented to the United Nations Human Rights Commission today, in outline form, its new theory of how the United Nations could best promote respect for human rights. The proposals did not get a very warm...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, April 8 -- The United States presented to the United Nations Human Rights Commission today, in outline form, its new theory of how the United Nations could best promote respect for human rights. The proposals did not get a very warm reception.
docs.abstract: Mrs Lord, reading Eisenhower wire reaffirming US stand, proposes study of rights throughout world, annual repts by govts on developments in field and UN advisory service on specific aspects of problem; India, Chile and Uruguay regret US stand; S Hoare (GB) says Comm erred in making civil rights vague

headline.main: U. S. 'RIGHTS' PLAN IS COOLLY RECEIVED; 3-Point Program Offered to U. N. Unit Finds Others Upset by Washington's Policy Shift

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 8 -- Fifty-two United Nations delegates voted today to set up an impartial inquiry into Communist charges that the United States had used germ weapons in the Korean war. However, because of Soviet refusal to cooperate,...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., April 8 -- Fifty-two United Nations delegates voted today to set up an impartial inquiry into Communist charges that the United States had used germ weapons in the Korean war. However, because of Soviet refusal to cooperate, the investigation probably never will be carried out.
docs.abstract: Assembly com, 52-5, backs impartial probe resolution; USSR bloc opposition makes actual probe improbable; AmbRomulo (PI) and Gross score USSR charges

headline.main: GERM WAR INQUIRY VOTED BY U. N. UNIT; Political and Security Group Backs Korea Move 52 to 5 -- Action Up to Assembly

headline.main: LINE PLANS 5 CRUISES; Moore - McCormack Schedules South American Tours

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO -- South American tourist circles look forward to a bumper harvest of United States tourist dollars this year, through a process of steady improvement rather than any sudden development. Ever since the war, the tourist traffic has...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO -- South American tourist circles look forward to a bumper harvest of United States tourist dollars this year, through a process of steady improvement rather than any sudden development. Ever since the war, the tourist traffic has steadily grown, with more ships becoming available all the time.

headline.main: TO RIO AND BEYOND; New Hotels Enlarging Tourist Facilities Along South America's East Coast

docs.snippet: WITH a successful winter-cruise season over, the steamship lines are now looking confidently to the coming summer when, according to advance indications, the volume of vacationists bent on taking sea trips to the Caribbean, South America, Hawaii or...
docs.lead_paragraph: WITH a successful winter-cruise season over, the steamship lines are now looking confidently to the coming summer when, according to advance indications, the volume of vacationists bent on taking sea trips to the Caribbean, South America, Hawaii or Alaska will be just as heavy as it was a year ago.
docs.abstract: travel time to Caribbean ports compared with air time

headline.main: BIG CRUISE SEASON; Advance Bookings Are Heavy for Spring Sailings, With Fewer Ships in Service

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was quiet during the past week due in part to the abbreviated session caused by the extended Easter holiday abroad. Business transacted was mostly routine and price fluctuation was narrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange market was quiet during the past week due in part to the abbreviated session caused by the extended Easter holiday abroad. Business transacted was mostly routine and price fluctuation was narrow.

docs.snippet: BEGINNING May 29, Turkey will observe a ten-day celebration of the 500th anniversary of Turkish rule over Istanbul. Twelve stamps are being issued to commemorate the fall of the city, then Constantinople, to Mohammed II the Conqueror.

docs.snippet: British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar fluctuated narrowly in foreign exchange trading during the past week. Amount of dealings reported were only moderate in volume and mostly routine.
